entry.title: San Andreas Lake
entry.summary:
Had an hour and change to walk along the San Andreas Lake outside of Burlingame. It's really interesting to live so close to one of the better known fault lines in the world. We'll have to go back again sometime.

View on Flickr
entry.content:
Had an hour and change to walk along the San Andreas Lake outside of Burlingame. It's really interesting to live so close to one of the better known fault lines in the world. We'll have to go back again sometime.

View on Flickr

entry.title: Half Moon Bay State Beach
entry.summary:
Three beaches in a row! Don't worry, there will be something new next time. And hey, at least this time, it isn't dead crabs. :)

entry.title: Pomponio State Beach
entry.summary:
It's been far too long since I took my camera out. Since our original morning plans got rained out, we decided to go to the beach instead. It's lovely being able to just drive to the ocean on a whim.

View on Flickr
entry.content:

entry.title: Yosemite
entry.summary:
We figured that since we live so close to Yosemite now (less than four hours) it would be a shame not to spend some time there. It's certainly different--no cell service unless you're in the heart of the park itself--but well worth it. So beautiful.

View on Flickr

entry.title: Santa Cruz
entry.summary:
My parents are visiting for the week, so we took a trip down to the Santa Cruz Boardwalk and neighboring Seabright State Beach. This time though, I took some pictures!

entry.title: Pacifica
entry.summary:
It feels good to be out and about taking pictures again. Aurora and I went down to the beach at Pacifica. We had once before, but this time we walked up the big hill / small mountain at the north end of the beach. Such a view!

View on Flickr

entry.title: Historical Photosets: 2005
entry.summary:
And here is the second half of my old photots, from 2005. I know that there should be more after these--I didn't just stop taking pictures for years. Yet so far I haven't found them. So it goes.

East Coast Exploration

From a family vacation to the East Cost: Baltimore, New York City, and Washington DC.

View on Flickr
entry.content:
And here is the second half of my old photots, from 2005. I know that there should be more after these--I didn't just stop taking pictures for years. Yet so far I haven't found them. So it goes.

East Coast Exploration

From a family vacation to the East Cost: Baltimore, New York City, and Washington DC.

Hiking at Hemlock

We took a field trip to Hemlock Cliffs. It was a lot of fun, the area is really good for pictures.

Cabin and Louie's

A combination of shots from the cabin that dad used to hang out at and Uncle Louie's house.

View on Flickr

Walking Maggie II

Walking Maggie again. Butt Hill is so named for the part of your body that gets a particular workout when you climb it.

View on Flickr

Stinklets ... And then Some

Young skunks are amazingly cute.

entry.title: Historical Photosets: 2004
entry.summary:
For rather too long I've been sitting on several years of old pictures I took, back before I first got my DSLR. Well, there's no time like the present!

Here is the first set, from 2004.

Firetower

One of the oldest sets I have--Hannah and I visited the fire tower at the Hoosier National Forest.

Here is the first set, from 2004.

Firetower

One of the oldest sets I have--Hannah and I visited the fire tower at the Hoosier National Forest.

A Random Field

Just behind home... So perhaps not so random after all?

Beta Convention

This year's National Beta Convention. IU really is a beautiful campus. I'm sure my parents would be thrilled if I ended up there in a few years.

(It's interesting how things turn out.)

Sunday

A lazy Sunday afternoon spent at my aunt's and uncle's house.

View on Flickr

Halloween

All Hallows' Eve spent at Patoka Lake.

View on Flickr

At Home II 2004-11-09

Another photoset at home. Nothing much more to say about it.

Hannah and I went riding across the highway from her house. It's interesting--such a feeling of freedom.

Olinger Thanksgiving 2004

Family Thanksgiving. My how the family is growing...

entry.title: Adventures in Florida
entry.summary:
Our first big trip and everything went just about as well as could be expected. We (almost) had a tropical storm (awesome), were lazy, and found a fair few neat things to see/do. I wouldn't be opposed to going back there some day.

View on Flickr

It had to have been the most liberal Catholic church I've ever been in... Personally, I'm a fan.

These are pretty much the only sunset shots I got. I had to stop in the middle of a run to do it... So worth it.
entry.content:
